name: Ragi Roti
history: Ragi Roti is a traditional flatbread from South India, particularly Karnataka. Made with ragi (finger millet) flour, it's known for its nutritional value and is a staple in many households. This roti is often enjoyed with chutneys or curries.
description: Ragi Roti is a healthy and delicious Indian flatbread made from ragi flour. It's often mixed with vegetables and spices, then pan-cooked to achieve a soft yet crispy texture. This roti is a great source of fiber and iron.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine ragi flour, chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, cumin seeds, and salt. Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough.

instructions.title: Shape the Roti
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Flatten each ball and roll it out on a lightly floured surface to form a roti.

instructions.title: Cook the Roti
instructions.description: Heat a griddle or tawa over medium heat. Place the roti on the griddle and cook until it starts to puff up. Flip and cook the other side, applying a little oil.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot Ragi Roti with chutney, curry, or yogurt.

tips: The dough should be soft and pliable for easy rolling.
You can add grated vegetables like carrot or cucumber for extra nutrition.
variations: Mix in spices like garam masala or red chili powder for a spicier version.
Use buttermilk instead of water for a tangy flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be stored for up to a day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container at room temperature.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a tawa or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a traditional banana leaf for an authentic experience.
Garnish with a side of freshly sliced onions and a lemon wedge.
